items.content:
Hello Stacey & Amanda,


Could you link me to the campaign t hey were referring to? Seems like they are experiencing a discrepancy in attributed conversions (from a campaign) vs. what their search feed partner is seeing. 


Also for my understanding: I am guessing there is no organic traffic for their Pixels? So all Pixel events should have come from traffic?


Regards,

Thomas

Hey Thomas!


Our client collected the 9 conversions on Feb 1 from several campaigns:


Ad Account: 7328481842099847169


Campaign ID: 

1789639003183122 - 2 conversions

1789747151861778 - 1 conversion

1789639020654625 - 1 conversion

1789639021741106 - 1 conversion

1789639024416818 - 1 conversion

1789561878987825 - 1 conversion

1789561857145890 - 1 conversion

1789472719082546 - 1 conversion


And no - there isn't organic traffic.  These will also almost always exclusively be click-conversions. View-through conversions would be extremely rare. And attribution is immediate with this type of activity.


What I did learn from another client (and what I was mentioning to you yesterday) is that seeing a 10% discrepancy would be considered 'acceptable' and would be because of a user clicking multiple times.  It isn't ideal, but will happen.


I hope this helps - and if not, maybe we can just run through what the client shared with me on our call tomorrow.


Thanks again for your help!  you are MAGIC!

Hey Stacey,


Thought I'd put together this diagram and talk through my line of thinking here. Based on what you are telling me both FB and TikTok events are accurate in one of the search partners, but not in Tonic. 



In box 1 (top left) - all Pixels and all partners are accurate. Both Pixels are firing within 10% of both search partners. This indicates accuracy verified by two sources (FB/TTK Pixel) and two endpoints (Sys 1 and Tonic)


In box 2 (top right) - There is an issue with a search partner in this case Tonic. Both Pixels are within 10% in System 1, but they are widely off within Tonic. 


In box 3 (bottom left) - There is an issue with one of the Pixels, in this case FB. The TTK Pixel is firing within 10% in both search partners platforms. However the FB Pixel is not firing within 10% in either platform. 


What they are describing sounds like box 2. If they are seeing both FB and TTK Pixel conversions come within 10% of what System 1 is showing but not in Tonic, then it is likely that Tonic is the issue. 


To confirm: does Tonic show the same discrepancy for FB conversions as well? If it does, then the culprit is likely Tonic. 


Hope this helps, thought I'd put together a diagram and hopefully save a Friday morning call. I am happy to still hop on a call and discuss tomorrow morning.


Regards,

Thomas

hey Thomas - we just heard from a client (who is search arb but managed by my colleague) who had a conversion discrepancy issue and they just shared:


We redid the tracking and it seems like the problem was in S2S tracking via Clickflare (in our case), where we did have some pretty long data holds, which meant that the pangle algorithm didn't get converison data in some cases for many hours. This led to 0 ad spend while there was 0 conversion flowing in. Now we use pixels for tracking and see incredible results. Ad spend is steady (in the last 2 days) and we see very low CPA's. On top of that we had a huge increase in Traffic Quality Score which is calculated on feed provider's side which before that was pretty low. We are talking about the x4 score increase. So Pixel tracking (not S2S) can be a fix for others facing the same issue.
Oh - I also canceled our meeting today. I'll see where the clients get to with this new info. Thanks for your help on this, Thomas.  It is definitely appreciated!!

Glad to hear they made some changes to resovle the discrepancies. 


It sounds like they were using "batching" which likely pools a batch of server events and sends them at regular intervals. When comparing that to the Pixel which fires real time, it could cause discrepancies. 


That is one of the potential downsides of batching server events for tracking web events. Generally we recommend that server events be tracked/sent in as close to real time as possible whether that is to Events API or in this case with a search partner. 


Thomas
Thanks, Thomas! I'll close the ticket and re-open if we need you again!  Happy Friday!
Client is requesting a call to run through their Pixel/Server events setup on 2-21 as they are still seeing some discrepancy issues.

our client has requested to cancel the meeting. She was able to meet with the third party reporting platform (Clickflare). Here was her response: We had a call w Clickflare today, they went over quite a bit w us and checked all of our integrations in Clickflare and in System1. We had made new UTC timezone accounts for S1 and for the Account ID: 7335888945139646466, the numbers are matching up ( very close) in TT, Clickflare and S1. We learned that S1 can show more conversions than actual conversions in TT as well since TT doesnt count the same user twice but S1 does. On Account ID: 7335573453803634690, the conversion number is matching on TT and clickflare but not on S1. We’ve raised this w clickflare now to see what the issue is.

items.content:
My client is seeing a discrepancy between the number of conversions recorded in TTAM (9) vs what their search feed partner is seeing (44 conversions (clicks = TTAM conversions)) for Feb 1, 2024. I showed her the TikTok pixel helper error message but she doesn't know what to do with it and the errors seem to be around content Id, and she is not passing back any PII so this would not be applicable. I can't get the QR code to load her LP so I can't do the diagnostic test in TTEM... Do you know why TTAM would record a much lower number of conversions than her search feed partner who should be seeing the exact same number?. (She is asking if the issue is that they created multiple access tokens...?) I have attached screenshots showing the errors we are seeing from the TikTok Pixel Helper (on the pixel and then on the 'AddToWishlist' event. I have asked the client to fix these errors but she tried and cannot find the issue.  I have added a few screenshots.  To note - the system1 conversion screenshot shows all domains - but the client said that they didn't have any other campaigns live.

Client is also not seeing conversions in  account ID: 7327003439798452226 - but they are receiving revenue from System1 (which would indicate that the event is firing).  

UPDATE - this client has 2 search feed partners; tonic and system1
She is not seeing this issue with her Tonic pixels, so she is wondering if the issue is with System1
"I have tested a pixel which we have been using for a while for a tonic campaign and connected it to a campaign on S1 as well. This pixel has been working fine.
Then tested the events on both T and S1 links. The below 3 are the T events and the top 2 are the S1 events which dont show complete payment and is showing an error." (see screenshot Apex test pixel for tonic and System1)
Pixel ID IDCL62OOBC77UCAD77NM50 under account ID: 7298397819499659266
This was the S1 link used: https://email-marketing-us-2726310.fyi?forcekeyA=Seo+Email+Marketing+In+North+Carolina&forcekeyB=Seo+Email+Marketing+In+Missouri&forcekeyC=Seo+Email+Marketing&forcekeyD=Email+Marketing+Management+Services&forcekeyE=Best+Automated+Email+Marketing&sub_id=__CAMPAIGN_ID__%7C__AID__&sub_id2=__CID__&ref=tiktok-__placement__&rskey=Email+marketing&headline=Elevate+Your+Strategy+with+Email+Marketing&ttid=CL62OOBC77UCAD77NM50&ttland=ViewContent&ttserp=AddToWishlist&ttclick=CompletePayment&ttclid=_CLICKID_


She also made text pixels but she continues to only get the two events (screenshot Text Pixels Two Events)
